executive_summary: ‚≠ê Eligibility for Extracorporeal Cardio-Pulmonary Resuscitation in Out-of-Hospital Cardiac Arrests in Sweden. ‚Äî This Swedish registry study found that only 1.4%‚Äì7.8% of witnessed out-of-hospital cardiac arrests (OHCA) would be eligi

‚≠ê Impact of Tumor Arterial Embolization on Hemodynamics During Surgical Resection of Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma in Children. ‚Äî This retrospective study suggests that preoperative tumor arterial embolization does not reduce intraoperative hemodynam

top_items.bottom_line: This Swedish registry study found that only 1.4%‚Äì7.8% of witnessed out-of-hospital cardiac arrests (OHCA) would be eligible for extracorporeal cardiopulmonary resuscitation (ECPR), with eligibility highly dependent on selection criteria and transport times; this highlights the limited but significant population for whom ECPR could be considered in clinical practice.
top_items.title: Eligibility for Extracorporeal Cardio-Pulmonary Resuscitation in Out-of-Hospital Cardiac Arrests in Sweden.

top_items.bottom_line: This retrospective study suggests that preoperative tumor arterial embolization does not reduce intraoperative hemodynamic instability or blood loss overall in pediatric pheochromocytoma/paraganglioma surgery, but may help high-risk children with large or highly active tumors achieve outcomes similar to lower-risk patients; evidence is limited by small sample size and retrospective design, but findings may guide perioperative management in select high-risk pediatric cases.
top_items.title: Impact of Tumor Arterial Embolization on Hemodynamics During Surgical Resection of Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma in Children.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: This article is an educational review summarizing current best practices, challenges, and strategies for tracheal intubation in head and neck surgery, emphasizing the importance of thorough preoperative evaluation, advanced airway techniques, and multidisciplinary collaboration, but does not present new clinical data or original research findings.
top_items.title: Tracheal intubation techniques in head and neck surgery: navigating challenges and enhancing airway safety

top_items.bottom_line: In this single-centre randomized controlled trial, extending individualised goal-directed fluid and blood pressure therapy into the postoperative period after oesophagectomy did not reduce postoperative morbidity compared to standard care, suggesting no clinical benefit to this more intensive approach despite increased fluid and vasopressor use.
top_items.title: Individualised Perioperative Blood Pressure and Fluid Therapy in Oesophagectomy a prospective, single-blind randomised controlled trial.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: This multicenter, double-blind, placebo-controlled randomized controlled trial found that intercostal nerve block (ICNB) outperforms erector spinae plane block (ESPB) for reducing postoperative pain and opioid requirements in the crucial early period after uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS), without compromising safety.
top_items.title: Intercostal nerve block outperforms ESPB for uniportal VATS

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: The 2026 ASA Practice Guideline provides updated, evidence-based recommendations for perioperative pain management in adults and children undergoing cardiothoracic, mastectomy, and abdominal surgeries, strongly endorsing fascial plane blocks for many procedures to reduce postoperative pain and opioid use, though evidence quality varies from moderate to low depending on procedure and population.
top_items.title: New ASA recommendations for surgical pain relief

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: The SOFA trial, a single-center randomized controlled study published in 2024, compared opioid-free anesthesia (using agents like ketamine, lidocaine, clonidine, and magnesium sulfate) to standard opioid-based anesthesia in major surgery, aiming to assess whether opioid-free approaches improve early postoperative quality of recovery and reduce opioid-related complications.
top_items.title: Opioid-free anesthesia in major surgery

top_items.bottom_line: This article announces that the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care (ESAIC) will adopt the GRADE methodology for guideline development starting in 2025, aiming to improve transparency, rigor, and clinical applicability; this transition is expected to enhance the quality and trustworthiness of future ESAIC guidelines, which is clinically important for informed decision-making.
top_items.title: Methodology series of ESAIC guidelines: standards in guidelines production.

top_items.bottom_line: In this large multicenter retrospective cohort study of over 778,000 deliveries, maternal peripartum cardiac arrest occurred at a rate of 11.2 per 100,000 deliveries, most commonly due to hemorrhage or amniotic fluid embolism, with higher risk in patients with advanced age, high BMI, certain racial backgrounds, and specific clinical conditions; these findings provide updated incidence and risk factor data to inform clinical vigilance and preparedness.
top_items.title: Frequency and Management of Maternal Peripartum Cardiac Arrest: A Multicenter Retrospective Cohort Analysis.

top_items.bottom_line: This systematic review and meta-analysis found that preoperative frailty, as measured by validated instruments, is common in older adults undergoing major cardiac procedures and is strongly associated with increased risks of postoperative complications, longer hospital stays, nonhome discharge, readmission, and higher short- and long-term mortality, underscoring the importance of frailty assessment in preoperative risk stratification for this population.
top_items.title: Association of Preoperative Frailty and Postoperative Outcomes in Older Adults Undergoing Major Cardiac Procedures: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis.

top_items.bottom_line: This large, prospective multicentre UK study found that known or predicted difficult airways are common in ICU patients, but most at-risk individuals are not clearly identified or do not have airway management plans, highlighting a significant gap in airway safety practices that warrants urgent clinical attention.
top_items.title: Identification of difficult airways in critical care units (ID-ACCT): a multicentre, survey-based prospective observational study.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: A new prospective study indicates that radiofrequency ablation for lumbar facet-mediated low back pain not only reduces pain but also significantly improves walking speed, providing objective evidence that RFA enhances functional mobility in patients with lumbar spinal arthritis beyond traditional subjective pain assessments.
top_items.title: Radiofrequency ablation boosts mobility in lumbar spinal arthritis

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: This article provides an educational overview of discussions at a NYSORA event, highlighting the importance of multimodal, non-opioid pain management strategies in cardiac and thoracic surgery, but does not present new clinical data or study results.
top_items.title: Industry Spotlight at NYSORA Events: Advancing Non-Opioid Pain Management in Cardiac and Thoracic Surgery

top_items.bottom_line: This small pilot study found that prolonged remimazolam infusion (‚â•24 h) in both surgical and medical ICU patients resulted in predictable, stable pharmacokinetics with no significant differences between groups, suggesting remimazolam may be suitable for extended sedation in critically ill patients, though larger studies are needed to confirm safety and efficacy.
top_items.title: Prolonged infusion of remimazolam in surgical and medical intensive care unit patients: a pilot pharmacokinetic study.

executive_summary: ‚≠ê Eligibility for Extracorporeal Cardio-Pulmonary Resuscitation in Out-of-Hospital Cardiac Arrests in Sweden. ‚Äî This Swedish registry study estimates that only 1.4%‚Äì7.8% of witnessed out-of-hospital cardiac arrests are eligible for

‚≠ê Impact of Tumor Arterial Embolization on Hemodynamics During Surgical Resection of Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma in Children. ‚Äî This retrospective cohort study suggests that preoperative tumor arterial embolization does not reduce intraoperative he

top_items.bottom_line: This Swedish registry study estimates that only 1.4%‚Äì7.8% of witnessed out-of-hospital cardiac arrests are eligible for ECPR annually, with eligibility highly dependent on selection criteria and transport times; this highlights the need for careful consideration of logistics and criteria when planning ECPR services.
top_items.title: Eligibility for Extracorporeal Cardio-Pulmonary Resuscitation in Out-of-Hospital Cardiac Arrests in Sweden.

top_items.bottom_line: This retrospective cohort study suggests that preoperative tumor arterial embolization does not reduce intraoperative hemodynamic instability or blood loss overall in pediatric pheochromocytoma/paraganglioma surgery, but may help high-risk children (with large or highly active tumors) achieve outcomes similar to lower-risk patients; evidence is limited by small sample size and retrospective design, but may inform perioperative planning in select pediatric cases.
top_items.title: Impact of Tumor Arterial Embolization on Hemodynamics During Surgical Resection of Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma in Children.

top_items.bottom_line: In this single-centre randomized controlled trial of 100 oesophagectomy patients, extending goal-directed fluid therapy with individualized blood pressure targets into the postoperative period increased fluid and vasopressor use but did not reduce postoperative complications at 30 days, suggesting no clinical benefit to this approach over standard care.
top_items.title: Individualised Perioperative Blood Pressure and Fluid Therapy in Oesophagectomy a prospective, single-blind randomised controlled trial.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: In a multicenter, double-blind, placebo-controlled randomized controlled trial, surgeon-delivered intercostal nerve block (ICNB) was found to outperform ultrasound-guided erector spinae plane block (ESPB) for reducing postoperative pain and opioid requirements in the early period after uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS).
top_items.title: Intercostal nerve block outperforms ESPB for uniportal VATS

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: This article provides an educational overview of discussions at a NYSORA event, highlighting the growing emphasis on multimodal, non-opioid strategies for postoperative pain management in cardiac and thoracic surgery, but does not present new clinical data or research findings.
top_items.title: Industry Spotlight at NYSORA Events: Advancing Non-Opioid Pain Management in Cardiac and Thoracic Surgery

top_items.bottom_line: In this randomized clinical trial of children undergoing adenotonsillectomy, the presence of both parents during the perioperative period modestly reduced preoperative anxiety compared to the presence of only one parent, without affecting postoperative delirium or parental anxiety; this suggests that allowing both parents may be beneficial for pediatric patient comfort.
top_items.title: The Impact of the Presence of Both Parents on Perioperative Anxiety in Children Undergoing Adenotonsillectomy Surgery: A Randomized Clinical Trial.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: This article is an educational review summarizing current best practices, challenges, and strategies for tracheal intubation in head and neck surgery, emphasizing the importance of thorough preoperative evaluation, advanced airway techniques, and multidisciplinary collaboration, but it does not present new clinical data or original research findings.
top_items.title: Tracheal intubation techniques in head and neck surgery: navigating challenges and enhancing airway safety

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: The 2026 ASA Practice Guideline provides updated, evidence-based recommendations emphasizing fascial plane blocks for perioperative pain management in cardiothoracic, mastectomy, and abdominal surgeries across age groups, aiming to reduce postoperative pain and opioid use, with recommendations tailored by procedure type and moderate-to-low evidence quality depending on the context.
top_items.title: New ASA recommendations for surgical pain relief

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: The SOFA trial, a single-center randomized controlled study published in 2024, compared opioid-free anesthesia (using agents like ketamine, lidocaine, clonidine, and magnesium sulfate) to standard opioid-based anesthesia in major surgery, aiming to assess whether opioid-free approaches improve early postoperative quality of recovery and reduce opioid-related complications.
top_items.title: Opioid-free anesthesia in major surgery

top_items.bottom_line: The ESAIC is transitioning to the GRADE methodology for guideline development starting in 2025, aiming to improve rigor, transparency, and clinical applicability; this shift is expected to enhance the quality and trustworthiness of future anaesthesiology and intensive care guidelines.
top_items.title: Methodology series of ESAIC guidelines: standards in guidelines production.

top_items.bottom_line: In this large multicenter retrospective cohort study of over 770,000 deliveries, peripartum, peri-anesthetic maternal cardiac arrest was rare (11.2 per 100,000), most commonly due to hemorrhage or amniotic fluid embolism, with two-thirds of patients surviving to 30 days; risk was higher in those with advanced age, high BMI, certain racial groups, and specific clinical conditions, highlighting the need for targeted
top_items.title: Frequency and Management of Maternal Peripartum Cardiac Arrest: A Multicenter Retrospective Cohort Analysis.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: A new prospective study indicates that radiofrequency ablation for lumbar spinal arthritis not only reduces pain but also significantly improves walking speed, providing objective evidence that RFA enhances functional mobility in patients with facet-mediated low back pain beyond traditional subjective pain assessments.
top_items.title: Radiofrequency ablation boosts mobility in lumbar spinal arthritis

top_items.bottom_line: This small pilot study found that prolonged remimazolam infusion (‚â•24 h) in both surgical and medical ICU patients resulted in predictable, stable pharmacokinetics without significant differences between groups, suggesting remimazolam may be suitable for extended sedation in critically ill patients, though larger studies are needed to confirm safety and efficacy.
top_items.title: Prolonged infusion of remimazolam in surgical and medical intensive care unit patients: a pilot pharmacokinetic study.

top_items.bottom_line: This large, multi-country post-hoc analysis found that differences in postoperative pulmonary complication rates among urological, gastrointestinal, and gynaecological abdominal surgeries are largely explained by patient factors and anaesthesia duration rather than surgical specialty itself, suggesting risk assessment should focus on these modifiable factors rather than the type of abdominal surgery alone.
top_items.channel: PubMed: Anaesthesia, Critical Care & Pain Medicine
top_items.title: Pulmonary Complications Following Urological, Gastrointestinal and Gynaecological Abdominal Surgery--a post-hoc analysis of an observational study in 29 countries.

executive_summary: ‚≠ê Vasopressor Use in Acute Burn Resuscitation: A Retrospective Study. ‚Äî In this large retrospective study of adults with major burns, early vasopressor use was associated with significantly hi

‚≠ê Parturients' Perspectives on Labor Pain and Epidural Analgesia: An Explorative Qualitative Study. ‚Äî This qualitative study highlights that epidural analgesia provides significant psychological as well as physical relief

top_items.bottom_line: In this large retrospective study of adults with major burns, early vasopressor use was associated with significantly higher rates of acute kidney injury, sepsis, and 30-day mortality even after propensity matching, suggesting caution with vasopressor initiation during acute burn resuscitation due to potential adverse outcomes.
top_items.title: Vasopressor Use in Acute Burn Resuscitation: A Retrospective Study.

top_items.bottom_line: This qualitative study highlights that epidural analgesia provides significant psychological as well as physical relief during labor, but individualized discussions about pain management goals are often lacking; clinicians should address both physical and psychological needs in antenatal and intrapartum care to improve patient-centered outcomes.
top_items.title: Parturients' Perspectives on Labor Pain and Epidural Analgesia: An Explorative Qualitative Study.

top_items.bottom_line: This systematic review and meta-analysis of 35 studies (including 23 clinical trials) found that Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) protocols in low- and middle-income countries significantly improve short- and intermediate-term postoperative outcomes, supporting their implementation to reduce surgical complications and improve recovery in these settings.
top_items.title: Evidence on Enhanced Recovery After Surgery Protocols in Low- and Middle-Income Countries: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis of Postoperative Outcomes.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: In a large retrospective study of over 2.5 million total hip and knee arthroplasty procedures from 2006‚Äì2021, neuraxial anesthesia was associated with significantly lower odds of major complications‚Äîincluding acute renal failure, blood transfusion, pneumonia, cardiac and pulmonary issues‚Äîas well as reduced ICU admissions and mechanical ventilation compared to general anesthesia.
top_items.title: Neuraxial vs general anesthesia in joint replacement

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: In patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty, adding a popliteal plexus block to a femoral triangle block provided modest reductions in early postoperative opioid consumption compared to femoral triangle block or adductor canal block alone, while preserving motor strength, according to the first randomized evidence evaluating this combined motor-sparing analgesic strategy.
top_items.title: Popliteal plexus block + femoral triangle block after TKA: Modest opioid savings with preserved strength

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: A newly published study in Pain Medicine (2025) reports that percutaneous laser disc decompression (PLDD), a minimally invasive procedure using focused laser energy to reduce disc pressure and size, provides significant structural and symptomatic relief for patients with lumbar disc herniation who have not responded to conservative treatments.
top_items.title: Percutaneous laser disc decompression offers significant relief for lumbar disc herniation

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: A decline in arterial blood pressure after surgery during the transition from the operating room to the ICU is associated with an increased risk of mortality and organ injury.
top_items.title: Blood Pressure Drop Between OR and ICU Mortality Risk

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: In mechanically ventilated adult ICU patients, a structured voice reorientation intervention using scripted family voice recordings, compared to usual care, was studied for its effect on reducing delirium; however, based solely on this excerpt, specific study results or conclusions regarding efficacy are not provided.
top_items.title: Delirium Reduction via Scripted Family Voice Recordings in Critically Ill Patients Receiving Mechanical Ventilation

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: The 2025 Perioperative Resuscitation and Life Support (PeRLS) guideline, developed by international experts using the GRADE methodology, provides updated, evidence-based recommendations tailored to the unique, highly monitored, and rapidly managed context of perioperative cardiac arrest, emphasizing timely diagnosis, targeted intervention, and context-specific resuscitation algorithms for anesthesiologists and critical care specialists.
top_items.title: Perioperative resuscitation and life support (PeRLS) 2025: redefining perioperative cardiac arrest management

top_items.bottom_line: Remimazolam appears to be as effective and safe as propofol or midazolam for ICU sedation, with favorable hemodynamic stability and no increased delirium or mortality risk, based on evidence from randomized trials, meta-analyses, and observational studies; its predictable recovery profile may aid ventilator weaning, making it a promising option for critically ill patients, though further ICU-specific research is warranted.
top_items.title: Safety and efficacy of remimazolam in critical illness.

top_items.bottom_line: In this large nationwide cohort study from South Korea, over half of ICU survivors developed post-intensive care syndrome (PICS) within 12 months, with risk factors including older age, female sex, lower income, pre-existing disability, comorbidities, and ICU interventions; these robust population-level data highlight the high incidence and key predictors of PICS, underscoring the need for targeted post-ICU care and monitoring.
top_items.title: Post-intensive care syndrome after critical illness: incidence and predictors in a nationwide cohort.

top_items.bottom_line: This large retrospective cohort study found that postoperative delirium detected in the PACU is strongly and independently associated with a higher risk of subsequent ward delirium, in-hospital falls, and 30-day mortality in older surgical patients, highlighting the clinical importance of early delirium screening and intervention in the immediate postoperative period.
top_items.title: Association between postoperative delirium in the postanaesthesia care unit and subsequent ward delirium: A retrospective cohort study.

top_items.bottom_line: In this prospective cohort study of post-cardiac surgery patients, greater end-expiratory lung volume loss and higher incidence of pendelluft during T-piece spontaneous breathing trials (SBT) were associated with SBT failure, suggesting that monitoring lung volume changes with electrical impedance tomography may help identify patients at risk for weaning failure; however, these findings require further validation before changing clinical practice.
top_items.title: Effects of two ventilator-weaning methods on lung volume and ventilation distribution by electrical impedance tomography in post-cardiac surgery patients: a prospective cohort study.

top_items.bottom_line: These 2024 guidelines provide 32 evidence-graded recommendations for emergency adult intubation outside the operating room and ICU, with 5 based on high-quality evidence and 12 on low-quality evidence, offering clinicians structured, consensus-based guidance for these high-risk scenarios.
top_items.channel: PubMed: Anaesthesia, Critical Care & Pain Medicine
top_items.title: Guidelines 2024: Emergency intubation of an adult outside the operating room and intensive care unit.
